What is the purpose of the `z_importwallet` command in Verus?
The `z_importwallet` command is used to import taddr and zaddr keys from a wallet export file in Verus.

z_importwallet "filename"

Imports taddr and zaddr keys from a wallet export file (see z_exportwallet).

Arguments:
1. "filename"  (string, required) The wallet file

Examples:

Dump the wallet
> verus z_exportwallet "nameofbackup"

Import the wallet
> verus z_importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"

Import using the json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_importwallet
How do I import a wallet in Verus using the command line?

To import a wallet in Verus using the command line, you can use the `z_importwallet` command followed by the path to the wallet file. For example:

```
verus z_importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"
```

z_importwallet "filename"

Imports taddr and zaddr keys from a wallet export file (see z_exportwallet).

Arguments:
1. "filename"  (string, required) The wallet file

Examples:

Dump the wallet
> verus z_exportwallet "nameofbackup"

Import the wallet
> verus z_importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"

Import using the json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_importwallet
How do I export a wallet in Verus using the command line?

To export a wallet in Verus using the command line, you can use the `z_exportwallet` command followed by the name of the backup file. For example:

```
verus z_exportwallet "nameofbackup"
```

z_importwallet "filename"

Imports taddr and zaddr keys from a wallet export file (see z_exportwallet).

Arguments:
1. "filename"  (string, required) The wallet file

Examples:

Dump the wallet
> verus z_exportwallet "nameofbackup"

Import the wallet
> verus z_importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"

Import using the json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_importwallet
Can I import a wallet in Verus using a JSON RPC call?

Yes, you can import a wallet in Verus using a JSON RPC call. Here's an example:

```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

Note that you need to replace `myusername` with your actual username and `path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup` with the actual path to your wallet file.
